name: anaerobic digestion plant construction, agriculture, with methane recovery | anaerobic digestion plant, agriculture, with methane recovery | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1984/documentation

This dataset refers to a multioutput process and represents the production of  the reference product "anaerobic digestion plant, agrcultural, with methane recovery" and five co-products: waste reinforced concrete, waste polyvinylchloride, waste wood, waste polystyrene, and waste plastic mixture. The inventory refers to a typical agricultural biogas plant with a dump of 90 m3, a fermenter with a capacity of 500m3 and a life time of 20 years.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From the land transformation/occupation and the reception of the construction materials (concrete, synthetic rubber, glued laminated timber, polystyrene, copper, polyethylene, steel, and polyvinylidenchloride) at the construction place.

This activity ends with an anaerobic digestion plant constructed.The dataset includes the production, transport and disposal of the main materials for an agricultural biogas plant.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Agriculture & Animal Husbandry

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This process refers to an agricultural biogas plant with a capacity of about 500m3. The data were sampled from 20 different plants in Switzerland.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: To avoid Methane emissions the new plants in Switzerland are covered. The dataset is based on data from standard plant in Switzerland in the  year 2006, a plant with methane recovery in the stock.;The average Swiss plant in the year 2006 was determined by evaluating 20 plants producing about 50% of the electricity from agricultural biogas plants. A typical Swiss plant has a concrete fermentation system and offers the possibility to treat co-substrates. ;Compared to the data given for the plants without covering the following differences occur:;because of the larger volume the major material used, like concrete or reinforcing steel, are use in larger quantities; because of the coverage a bigger amount of rubber is used.;A schematic plant design is given below:
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: no extrapolation was necessary because the typical plants for the region and time period were evaluated
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data are the average of 20 from 70 plants in Switzerland

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Average Swiss plant in the year 2006 with a concrete fermentation system and offering the possibility to treat co-substrates. The pit is 90 m3 and the fermenter (digestion
facility) has a capacity of about 500 m3. The lifetime of the plant is assumed to be 20 years.
